rev.comment: Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/92.22.189.39|92.22.189.39]]; Unexplained removal of content. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
rev.diff:
Line 229: Line 229:
==Vendor support==
==Vendor support==
â
A number of vendors offer computers with Ubuntu pre-installed, including [[Dell]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/dell |title=Ubuntu on Dell |accessdate=2008-02-24 |publisher=[[Canonical Ltd.]]}}</ref>, [[Tesco]], OP3, Gliese IT, [[System76]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dell.com/content/topics/segtopic.aspx/linux_3x?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs |title=Ubuntu Customers |accessdate=2008-08-19 |publisher=[[Dell, Inc]]}}</ref>, [[Sharp Corporation]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liliputing.com/2009/08/sharp-netwalker-pc-z1-what-you-get-when-you-shrink-a-netbook.html |title=Sharp NetWalker PC-Z1: What you get when you shrink a netbook |accessdate=2010-03-26 |publisher=Liliputing}}</ref> and the South African company Bravium Computers.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://bravium.co.za/about |title=Ubuntu Computers |accessdate=2009-04-23 |publisher=Bravium Computers}}</ref> Dell and System76 customers are able to choose between 30-day, three-month, and yearly Ubuntu support plans through Canonical.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/news/system76-certified-servers |title=System76 announces servers with Ubuntu 7.10 and Canonical support services |accessdate=2008-03-05 |publisher=[[Canonical Ltd.]]}}</ref>.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://yourblog.dell.com/2008/07/18/dell-upgrades-consumer-linux-pcs-to-ubuntu-804/ |title=Your Blog Â» Blog Archive Â» Dell Upgrades Consumer Linux PCs to Ubuntu 8.04 |publisher=Dell.com |date= |accessdate=2008-09-13}}</ref>
+
A number of vendors offer computers with Ubuntu pre-installed, including [[Dell]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/dell |title=Ubuntu on Dell |accessdate=2008-02-24 |publisher=[[Canonical Ltd.]]}}</ref>, [[Tesco]], OP3, Gliese IT, [[System76]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dell.com/content/topics/segtopic.aspx/linux_3x?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs |title=Ubuntu Customers |accessdate=2008-08-19 |publisher=[[Dell, Inc]]}}</ref>, [[Sharp Corporation]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liliputing.com/2009/08/sharp-netwalker-pc-z1-what-you-get-when-you-shrink-a-netbook.html |title=Sharp NetWalker PC-Z1: What you get when you shrink a netbook |accessdate=2010-03-26 |publisher=Liliputing}}</ref> and the South African company Bravium Computers.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://bravium.co.za/about |title=Ubuntu Computers |accessdate=2009-04-23 |publisher=Bravium Computers}}</ref> Dell and System76 customers are able to choose between 30-day, three-month, and yearly Ubuntu support plans through Canonical.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/news/system76-certified-servers |title=System76 announces servers with Ubuntu 7.10 and Canonical support services |accessdate=2008-03-05 |publisher=[[Canonical Ltd.]]}}</ref> Dell computers (running Ubuntu 8.04 or 9.04) include extra support for [[ATI]] Video Graphics, Dell Wireless, [[Fingerprint Readers]], [[HDMI]], [[Bluetooth]], DVD Playback (using [[LinDVD]]), and [[MP3]]/[[WMA]]/[[WMV]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://yourblog.dell.com/2008/07/18/dell-upgrades-consumer-linux-pcs-to-ubuntu-804/ |title=Your Blog Â» Blog Archive Â» Dell Upgrades Consumer Linux PCs to Ubuntu 8.04 |publisher=Dell.com |date= |accessdate=2008-09-13}}</ref>
